Elections
=========

**Election Information**
------------------------

The Town Secretary's Office is responsible for conducting Municipal Elections as prescribed by the [Election Code of the State of Texas](https://statutes.capitol.texas.gov/?link=EL). Municipal elections are held on the first Saturday in May of each year, as authorized by state law.

The Double Oak Town Council is composed of a mayor and five council members.

[![Voter Registration](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/682152fec643c844598dff3f/829bb2ab-fae3-4f72-9b1d-c311b64aacb7/Voter+Registration.png)](https://www.votedenton.gov/voter-information/voter-registration/)

[![Voting Locations](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/682152fec643c844598dff3f/85b8ea90-a46c-443f-b5a6-babf0d5d1d55/Voting+Locations+v3.png)](https://www.votedenton.gov/election-day-information/current-and-upcoming-election-information/)

[![Candidate Information](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/682152fec643c844598dff3f/ca8a3260-1d29-4f82-ba46-bf0468ce5e96/Candidate+Information+v3.png)](https://doubleoak.texas.gov/candidate-information-2025)

[**Candidate Information (2024)**](https://doubleoak.texas.gov/candidate-information-2024)

**2025-2026** [**Internet**](https://doubleoak.texas.gov/s/2024-2025_internet-posting-requirement-9z83.pdf) **Posting Requirements**

[**ELECTION SIGNAGE TOWN POLICIES**](https://doubleoak.texas.gov/s/Double-Oak-Political-Sign-Policy-Final.docx)

**General Municipal Election**
------------------------------

The Town Secretary’s Office is responsible for conducting Municipal Elections as prescribed by the [Election Code of the State of Texas](https://statutes.capitol.texas.gov/?link=EL).

The General Municipal Election is conducted each year on the first Saturday in May.

All Council Members are elected for a two year term are elected at-large, meaning they represent the entire Town.

Additional information can be found on the [Denton County Elections Administration](https://www.votedenton.gov/) website.

**May 2, 2026 General Election**
--------------------------------

The next Town General Election will be held Saturday, May 2, 2026, from 7 am - 7 pm, to elect three Council members for two-year terms.

* First day to file for place on the ballot - January 14, 2026.
* Deadline for filing for candidacy is February 13, 2026, at 5:00 p.m.
* [Notice of Deadline to File Applications for Place on the Ballot](https://doubleoak.texas.gov/s/Notice-App-Deadline-2026.pdf)
* Early voting and Election Day voting will be listed once determined by the Denton County Elections Administrator.
* Candidate Packets may be picked up at Town Hall on January 14, 2026. Submittals may be made starting January 14, 2026, and ending on February 13, 2026, at 5 pm.
* [Double Oak Order of Election 2026](https://doubleoak.texas.gov/s/Double-Oak-Order-of-Election.pdf)

**Qualifications for office**
-----------------------------

All candidates for office must be citizens of the United States, have lived in the state for a minimum of one year prior to the filing deadline, be a resident of the Town of Double Oak for six months prior to the filing deadline; must be a registered voter of the territory elected from as of the filing deadline, and be a minimum of 18 years of age.

Qualified residents interested in filing for a place on the ballot may obtain more information.  Should you have any questions please contact Lynn Jones, Town Secretary at 972-539-9464 ext. 1001 [lynn.jones@doubleoak.texas.gov](mailto:lynn.jones@doubleoak.texas.gov).

Additional information can be found on the [Denton County Elections Administration](https://www.votedenton.gov/elections-office/) website.

**Future Elections**
--------------------

May 2, 2026 - General Election to elect 3 Council Members to a 2-year term

May 1, 2027 - General Election to elect Mayor and 2 Council Members to a 2-year term

May 6, 2028 - General Election to elect 3 Council Members to a 2-year term

May 5, 2029 - General Election to elect Mayor and 2 Council Members to a 2-year term

May 4, 2030 - General Election to elect 3 Council Members to a 2-year term
